SENT.plain: SALL1 is one of three human homologues of the Drosophila region-specific homeotic gene spalt (sal)
Mutations of SALL1 on chromosome 16q12.1 cause Townes--Brocks syndrome (TBS) which is characterized by defects in multiple organ systems including limbs, ears, kidneys and anus
Here, we have analyzed the expression of the mouse homologue of SALL1 (Sall1) during early embryogenesis
Sall1 expression is very prominent in the developing brain and the limbs
Other sites of expression include the meso- and metanephros, lens, olfactory bulbs, heart, primitive streak and the genital tubercle
Hence, Sall1 expression to a large degree reflects the structures affected in human TBS
